dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9291 IH: To require a report on the death of Shireen Abu Akleh.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carson (for himself, Mr. Beyer, Ms. Bush, Mr. DeSaulnier, Mrs. Dingell, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. García of Illinois, Ms. Jacobs of California, Ms. Jayapal, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. McCollum, Mr. McGovern, Ms. Newman, Ms. Norton, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez, Ms. Omar, Ms. Tlaib, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To require a report on the death of Shireen Abu Akleh.

section.header: Report on death of Shireen Abu Akleh

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and Secretary of State, in consultation with the Director of National Intelligence and the Secretary of Defense, shall submit to Congress a report on the death of Shireen Abu Akleh.
The report required by subsection (a) shall include—

paragraph.text: an identification of those individuals or entities that carried out, participated in, or were otherwise complicit in, or responsible for the death of Shireen Abu Akleh; and
an identification of any United States defense materials or services were implicated in the death of Shireen Abu Akleh.

subsection.text: The report required by subsection (a) shall be submitted in unclassified form and made available to the public at the same time on the website of the Department of State.
